intro: Sebastiania angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique morphological features. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded habitats. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
